extracted_playbook.title: Identify Affected Confluence Version
extracted_playbook.description: Check if the Confluence instance is running a version between 8.0.0 and 8.5.1, which are affected by the vulnerability.

extracted_playbook.condition: Is upgrading to a fixed version possible?

extracted_playbook.title: Upgrade Confluence to a Fixed Version
extracted_playbook.description: Upgrade Confluence to version 8.3.3, 8.4.3, 8.5.2, or any later version to fix the vulnerability.

extracted_playbook.title: Verify Confluence Instances Post-Upgrade
extracted_playbook.description: After upgrading, check all affected Confluence instances for unexpected members in 'confluence-administrators', newly created user accounts, requests to '/setup/*.action', presence of '/setup/setupadministrator.action' in logs, and '/server-info.action' in network access logs.

extracted_playbook.title: Restrict External Network Access
extracted_playbook.description: Restrict external network access to the affected Confluence instance to prevent unauthorized access.

extracted_playbook.title: Block Access to '/setup/*' Endpoints
extracted_playbook.description: Block access to the '/setup/*' endpoints by modifying configuration files and restarting Confluence.

extracted_playbook.title: Verify Confluence Instances Without Upgrade
extracted_playbook.description: Check all affected Confluence instances for unexpected members in 'confluence-administrators', newly created user accounts, requests to '/setup/*.action', presence of '/setup/setupadministrator.action' in logs, and '/server-info.action' in network access logs.
